channel.title: Java Bug System
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [JDK-8323635] Test gc/g1/TestHumongousAllocConcurrentStart.java fails with -XX:TieredStopAtLevel=3
item.description:
Test gc/g1/TestHumongousAllocConcurrentStart.java
fails with
'-Xcomp -ea -esa -XX:CompileThreshold=100 -XX:+UnlockExperimentalVMOptions -XX:TieredStopAtLevel=3'

Failure is very intermittent:

stdout: [[0.015s][info][gc] Using G1
[2.986s][info][gc] GC(0) Pause Young (Concurrent Start) (CodeCache GC Threshold) 2M->1M(224M) 5.198ms
[2.986s][info][gc] GC(1) Concurrent Mark Cycle
[3.027s][info][gc] GC(1) Pause Remark 1M->1M(224M) 31.694ms
[3.034s][info][gc] GC(1) Pause Cleanup 1M->1M(224M) 0.328ms
[3.035s][info][gc] GC(1) Concurrent Mark Cycle 49.149ms
Allocating humongous object 1/113 of size 786432 bytes

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Fix request [21u]

I backport this for parity with 21.0.5-oracle.
No risk, only a test change.
Clean backport.
Test pass. SAP nightly testing passed.

A pull request was submitted for review.
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk11u-dev/pull/2717
Date: 2024-05-20 08:30:26 +0000

A pull request was submitted for review.
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk21u-dev/pull/589
Date: 2024-05-20 08:08:56 +0000

A pull request was submitted for review.
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk17u-dev/pull/2482
Date: 2024-05-20 08:09:16 +0000

Changeset: 5045839c
Author: Thomas Schatzl <tschatzl@openjdk.org>
Date: 2024-01-16 12:00:57 +0000
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk/commit/5045839cb2095105a5c6c9eebc633a78b1e3213e

A pull request was submitted for review.
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk/pull/17419
Date: 2024-01-15 09:56:12 +0000
Interestingly I can only reproduce this on aarch64 because only there the codecache initiated gc happens.

The problem is that that codecache induced concurrent marking starts a (legitimate) old reclamation phase, i.e. waiting for prepare mixed/mixed gcs.
These never happen because there is no young gen allocation. That prevents a marking cycle start caused by humongous allocation, causing the test failure.
